body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

### Problem
In some e2e tests, `framework.AddCleanupAction()` is used:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/1a4a019e5f84637f125589288edca46a974c1486/test/e2e/apimachinery/webhook.go#L50-L52

These cleanup actions are expected to be called when tests are terminated, by calling `framework.RunCleanupActions()` in test/e2e/e2e.go. The problem is that, in test/e2e/e2e.go, duplicated add/remove/run cleanup actions codes are implemented, and the `RunCleanupActions()` in test/e2e is wrongly used:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/1a4a019e5f84637f125589288edca46a974c1486/test/e2e/e2e.go#L294-L301

This caused the aformentioned clean up actions added in e2e tests not being called.

### Solution
In test/e2e/e2e.go, we should remove the duplicate "cleanup action" code, and use the clean up code in test/e2e/framework instead.

However, e2e tests won't pass after this is fixed. It's because some e2e tests added clean up functions (functions added in`framework.AddCleanupAction()`) that don't work. For example, in test/e2e/apimachinery/webhook.go, `cleanWebhookTest(f)` uses `f *framework.Framework` as input, whereas `f` already becomes `nil` by the time clean up actions are called. This can be solved by storing required variables in `BeforeEach`:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/1a4a019e5f84637f125589288edca46a974c1486/test/e2e/apps/deployment.go#L67-L70

@kubernetes/sig-testing-bugs

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Testing.
labels.name: sig/testing

title: Clean up actions are not used correctly in e2e tests
